1004946.title: Inefficient Regular Expression Complexity in chalk/ansi-regex
1004946.overview: ansi-regex is vulnerable to Inefficient Regular Expression Complexity

1004967.title: Inefficient Regular Expression Complexity in nth-check
1004967.overview: nth-check is vulnerable to Inefficient Regular Expression Complexity

1005059.title: Uncontrolled Resource Consumption in ansi-html
1005059.overview: This affects all versions of package ansi-html. If an attacker provides a malicious string, it will get stuck processing the input for an extremely long time.

1005154.title: Regular expression denial of service
1005154.overview: This affects the package glob-parent before 5.1.2. The enclosure regex used to check for strings ending in enclosure containing path separator.

1006724.title: json-schema is vulnerable to Prototype Pollution
1006724.overview: json-schema is vulnerable to Improperly Controlled Modification of Object Prototype Attributes ('Prototype Pollution')

1006846.title: Regular Expression Denial of Service in postcss
1006846.overview: The package postcss before 8.2.13 are vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) via getAnnotationURL() and loadAnnotation() in lib/previous-map.js. The vulnerable regexes are caused mainly by the sub-pattern \/\*\s* sourceMappingURL=(.*).

1006852.title: Prototype Pollution in node-forge debug API.
1006852.overview:
### Impact
The `forge.debug` API had a potential prototype pollution issue if called with untrusted input. The API was only used for internal debug purposes in a safe way and never documented or advertised.  It is suspected that uses of this API, if any exist, would likely not have used untrusted inputs in a vulnerable way.

### Patches
The `forge.debug` API and related functions were removed in 1.0.0.

### Workarounds
Don't use the `forge.debug` API directly or indirectly with untrusted input.

### References
- https://www.huntr.dev/bounties/1-npm-node-forge/

### For more information
If you have any questions or comments about this advisory:
* Open an issue in [forge](https://github.com/digitalbazaar/forge).
* Email us at support@digitalbazaar.com.

1006854.title: URL parsing in node-forge could lead to undesired behavior.
1006854.overview:
### Impact
The regex used for the `forge.util.parseUrl` API would not properly parse certain inputs resulting in a parsed data structure that could lead to undesired behavior.

### Patches
`forge.util.parseUrl` and other very old related URL APIs were removed in 1.0.0 in favor of letting applications use the more modern WHATWG URL Standard API.

### Workarounds
Ensure code does not directly or indirectly call `forge.util.parseUrl` with untrusted input.

### References
- https://www.huntr.dev/bounties/41852c50-3c6d-4703-8c55-4db27164a4ae/

### For more information
If you have any questions or comments about this advisory:
* Open an issue in [forge](https://github.com/digitalbazaar/forge)
* Email us at support@digitalbazaar.com
